# Preparation and administration

# 4.3 Installation

# Licensing mode (Windows Server 2012 R2)

Ensure that the operating systems are licensed correctly on all PCS 7 stations and that adequate Microsoft Client Access licenses (CAL) are available for accessing a Windows server operating system via the network.

All stations with a Windows server operating system installed are set to "Pro Server" licensing mode in their control panel as standard.

Select the "per device or per user" option button for the licensing mode if more than one server or more than five clients are present in one area.

You can use the "Licensing" tool (Folder start menu > Administrative Tools) to manage the CAL settings centrally from a Windows server in a network with multiple Windows servers.

Example configuration: Redundant OS server (2 servers), 5 OS clients, and 1 ES

|5 CALs|are available for each OS server|
|---|---|
|Each OS client or ES|requires 1 CAL|
|Available CALs|10 CALs (red. OS server)|
|Required CALs|5 CALs (OS clients) + 1 CAL (ES) = 6 CALs|
|Reserve|4 CALs|

Note
At a changeover to a newer Windows Server version (e.g. Windows Server 2008 R2 to Windows Server 2012 R2), the CALs must also be adapted to the new version.

# Internet time

Ensure that the Windows system time is not automatically synchronized via the Internet where the PC stations are operated in a workgroup (Change date/time > Internet time).
Q: What licensing mode should be selected for Windows Server 2012 R2 in a PCS 7 environment with more than one server or more than five clients?
A: For environments with over one server or five clients, choose 'per device or per user' licensing.

NODE_TEXT:
Change the existing default passwords.
- Deactivate any unneeded floppy disk, CD or DVD drives. This applies principally to the operator stations.
- Deactivate USB port functions that are not required. This applies principally to the operator stations.
- Deactivate the boot menu display and set the hard disk with system partition at the initial position of the boot sequence.

Note

You can find further information in the "PCS 7 Readme V9.0" (https://support.industry.siemens.com/cs/ww/en/view/109744312) document.
